gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਕੋਪ ਕਰੰ ਸਿਵ ਸੂਲ ਲੀਯੋ ॥ ਅਰ ਕੋ ਸਿਰ ਕਾਟ ਦੁਖੰਡ ਕੀਯੋ ॥੩੯॥
transliteration: Tab Kop Karan Siv Sool Leeyo|| Ark O Sir Kaat Doukhanndkeeyo||39||
translation: Then greatly infuriated, Shiva took the trident in his hand, and cut the head of the enemy into two parts.39.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਤਿ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਬਚਿਤ੍ਰ ਨਾਟਕੇ ਪਿਨਾਕ ਪਰਬਧਹਿ ਅੰਧਕ ਬਧਹਿ ਰੁਦ੍ਰੋ ਸਤਤੇ ਧਿਅਾੲਿ ਸਮਾਪਤ ਸਤੁ ॥
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatake Pinaak Parbadhah(i) Andhak Badhah(i) Rudro Sat-te Dhiaae Samaapat Sat(u)||
translation: End of the description of the killing of the demon ANDHAK and the Eulogy of SHIVA in BACHITTAR NATAK.
Now begins the description of the killing of Parbati:
Let Sri Bhagauti ji (The Primal Lord) be helpful.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਰ ਰਾਜ ਪ੍ਰਸੰਨਿ ਭੲੇ ਤਬਹੀ ॥ ਅਰ ਅੰਧਕ ਨਾਸ ਸੁਨਿਯੋ ਜਬ ਹੀ ॥
transliteration: Sur Raaj Prasann(i) Bhae Tab-hee|| Ar Andhak Naas Souniyo Jab Hee||
translation: When Indra heard about the destruction of Andhakasura he was very much pleased.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਮ ਕੈ ਦਿਨ ਕੇਤਕ ਬੀਤ ਗੲੇ ॥ ਸਿਵਧਾਮ ਸਤਕ੍ਰਿਤ ਜਾਤ ਭੲੇ ॥੧॥
transliteration: Im Kai Din Ketak Beet Gad|| Sivdhaam Satkrit Jaat Bhae||1||
translation: In this way, may days elapsed and Shiva also went to Indra’s place.1.

gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਰੁਦ੍ਰ ਭਯਾਨਕ ਰੂਪ ਧਰਯੋ ॥ ਹਰਿ ਹੇਰਿ ਹਰੰ ਹਥਿਯਾਰ ਹਰਯੋ ॥
transliteration: Tab Rudra Bhyaanak Roop Ddaryo|| Har(i) Her(i) Haran Hathiyaar Daryo||
translation: Then Rudra manifested himself in a dreadful form; seeing Shiva, Indra discharged his wapons.

gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਹੀ ਸਿਵ ਕੋਪ ਅਖੰਡ ਕੀਯੋ ॥ ੲਿਕ ਜਨਮ ਅੰਗਾਰ ਅਪਾਰ ਲੀਯੋ ॥੨॥
transliteration: Tab Hisiv Kip Akhannddkeeyo|| Ik Janam Anadr Apaar Leeyo||2||
translation: Then Shiva was highly infuriated and blazed like a live charcoal.2.

gurmukhi: ਤਿਹ ਤੇਜ ਜਰੇ ਜਗਜੀਵ ਸਬੈ ॥ ਤਿਹ ਡਾਰ ਦਯੋ ਮਧਿ ਸਿੰਧ ਤਬੈ ॥
transliteration: Tih Tej Dare Jagjeev Sabai|| Tih Daar Dayo Madh(i) Sindh Tabai||
translation: With that blaze, all the beings of the world began to burn. Then Shiva in order to pacify his anger threw his weapon and anger into the sea;

gurmukhi: ਸੋੳੂ ਡਾਰ ਦਯੋ ਸਿੰਧ ਮਹਿ ਨ ਗਯੋ ॥ ਤਿਹ ਅਾਨ ਜਲੰਧਰ ਰੂਪ ਲਯੋ ॥੩॥
transliteration: Sooo Daar Dyo Sindh Maih Na Gado|| Tih Aan Jalandhar Roop Layo||3||
translation: But it could not be drowned and manifested itself in the from of the demon Jalandhar.3.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਹ ਬਿਧਿ ਭਯੋ ਅਸੁਰ ਬਲਵਾਨਾ ॥ ਲਯੋ ਕੁਬੇਰ ਕੋ ਲੂਟ ਖਜਾਨਾ ॥
transliteration: Eh Bidh(i) Bhayo Asur Balvaanaa|| Layo Kouber Ko Loot Khajaanaa||
translation: In this way, this demon grew in strength excessively and he also looted the treasure of Kuber.
